title: Infernal Diana vs Wildfire Zyra
body:
It might just be me - but these two skins are too much alike.
When I saw Infernal Diana on the news sites I immediately processed it as some sort of touch up to Wildfire Zyra.  I actually scrolled past it three times before I realized it was actually Diana's new skin.

All the visual reads are the same - similar body type, almost identical hair shape, exposed shoulders and chest, similar skin coloration, extremely similar "armor"/clothing.

http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nJF34OlggXQ/VJMF4Q0phGI/AAAAAAAARGU/91chlXkQJkM/s1600/alvzyra.jpg
https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-20JEbfMqm_0/VwQZHz2oryI/AAAAAAAANDI/uTgXImIP13EQF9BWo15f_lWLR7lrCSgMw/s1600/dianaturn.jpg

replies.body:
Glad to know I'm not the only one who thought it was a Wildfire Zyra change. 

Not sure what they can do to fix it, given that the two have nearly identical silhouettes.
They could go for a more contrasting skintone and fire color. Bright white/holy fire maybe? or go underworld/hell fire and pale green or blue fire.
If only the ice team won...
Remember when Dark Valkyrie Diana look like Syndra before they remove Dark Diana's helmet.
Poor Diana can't catch a break...

Man I thought I was the only one. They were hyping us so much for this that it ended up flopping. The recall animation is meh for me as well. What they can do is  to recolor the fire just like the latest brand skin. Honestly there are different fire colors.  

This fire themed custom skin is way better imo. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wqppYcBK49g
IMO the effects are better but the skin itself is lacking.
holy crap that is amazing actually

I think the recall animation feels off, too. To actually analyze what seems off for me, I think it's something about the way she hefts her blade over herself at first, the way the blade actually is moved and how it sounds like it's way too heavy as she drags it, the sound-effect used, too, sounds like it's moving against stone where her default recall just has the sound effect of interacting with dirt (which might jar me with such a harder sound), then the flaming arc that appears where the blade wasn't actually touching (and maybe having the blade arc out along this line as she drags it would look better anyways?), and... probably the uncharacteristic hip-pop. :|
They were working too hard on those SKT skins.  Too bad they're a flop as well.
I completely disagree with this, i think they are amazing, especially the sivir one, throwing the SKT Logo??? C'mon, thats cool
They aren't the worst, I do like Sivir, but as a whole they seem pretty under par compared to other team-themed skins. Just my opinion.

> [{quoted}](name=Villiers,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=qcJARsXN,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2016-04-06T01:50:59.960+0000)
>
> They aren't the worst, I do like Sivir, but as a whole they seem pretty under par compared to other team-themed skins. Just my opinion.

i like spider elise
The Elise one is quite nice.
Elise one is amazing! Renek is okish, Sivir is decent aswell.
Ryze got a laptop. A LAPTOP!!!!!!!

I had my doubts about how the skin would turn out the moment I found out Team Fire won and Diana was getting the skin. Team Ice? Now that would have been super cool and easy for me to imagine and working with Diana's character.

it's not a *bad* skin, they did put a lot of work in it...but lots of things look and feel super awkward about it. :/
Some of the movements for her armor look awkward, like the "tail" of her suit, but otherwise the armor isn't bad.

I think they overdid the whole on-fire thing, especially with her hair/skin tone. She looks like a really angry fire/lava imp.

The skin also doesn't immediately scream "fire" to me; feels more aligned to lava.

Agreed, 2 years ago we were told if the only released Diana skin is "not our cup of tea" then wait for one in 6 months. 2 years later we get this ONLY because it won a popularity vote. Not buying. It looks like an intern very begrudgingly did 15 minutes of texture/colour work and called it a day. Absolutely no chance that I buy this.

The texture on her forehead gem/fire things are so low resolution you can count their pixels while fully zoomed out. It's distracting. Standard Riot quality I've come to expect.
Diana has 2 skins Dark Valkyrie (her release skin) and Lunar Goddess.
... I obviously meant she's had only 1 skin released since her release skin in 2012.
One is Dark Red, the other is Dark Orange....

Flame themed skins are typically the most uncreative skins, they're just "X champion but ON FIRE!"

There was so much potential for going with something cool this time like a fire dancer or something.

I actually really like everything below the neck. That design looks slick.

The fire effect on the head is far too strong, though. Completely overpowers the design.

I actually really like the Diana hair at least compared to the Zyra hair.

Maybe it could do with being toned down a bit but at least it actually looks like it belongs on the skin.

How do they let someone of the moon (which I've heard called cold, and silver is a cool color) have a fire themed skin while keeping all of her moon dialogue? How is her anti-joke about the sun burning people alive going to work if she's all fiery?
lol I'll give you the one about her joke, but I think it's a little more interesting to branch out from relating back to her cold demeanor.

I don't think the op was making a case for lack of creativity or quality. Seems more like a gameplay oriented complaint where champions look too much alike to tell them apart. It's the same as some others like Soul reaper draven - Kha'zix, and a few others I can't think of off the top of my head. When you attack one champ, thinking it's another in the heat of the moment, problems arise.

Agreed, there should be a way to better distinguish between the two.

Diana does have her sword but in the heat of a team fight one may not have time to look for that small detail.
Yyyeaaah that's dangerously similar.

Glad I'm not the only one who instantly thought of the Zyra skin. I bought the Zyra bundle the day it was launched, and it looks like they're re-releasing it with a nice upgrade to the particles associated with the hair, clothing, etc.
Wildfire Zyra was the first thing I thought of when I saw Di's new skin, actually!
well being color blind just got worst :-(
While you can tell which one is which due to the color of the flames and the presence of Diana's blade, I do agree that they look too similar.

Yeah, i am not seeing it maybe on ultra low resolution they look similar, but there are clear differences between the two of them.  I kinda like it, but i do feel that the Head needs some work, its just doesn't click with the rest of the model for me.

Sadly they missed the chance to make a great fire themed Diana skin that still had a basis from things seen in the sky. Some cultures beheld auroras as spiritual fire. Not to mention that would have had a nice large color range to work with to avoid similarities...
That's... actually a _really_ cool idea. o_o

Infernal Diana's pricing should be adjusted to 975 RP because there are other skins in that tier (say Arclight Vayne) that have a similar pricing while clearly putting the same if not more amount of effort.

I can see where you're coming from, but I myself would argue the color scheme's are differing enough to the point of being distinguishable. Zyra's skin is much redder and brighter, whereas Diana's is more... molten, for lack of a better word. But now that screws a Zyra VU, because then they'll realize when they try to update that skin on her that it's going to look like the Diana one. I think they should both just have the same names to make it better. Infernal Zyra maybe? Seems like the easier choice to make since we actually have a skin line going for Infernal.
It's kind of disappointing.
They said they were planning on a low tier VU for Zyra (colors in particular) when they launch the MYMU, so hopefully they'll fix it then.
That was only for her base skin, though. :(
Whenever they do a VU on a champ they do it to all of their skins at the same time.

[It was said by a red that they're only doing her base skin right now.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/rwlMgEdo-can-we-expect-big-visual-updates-on-the-mage-rework?comment=000100010000)

I've heard the same about Warden Sivir and Classic Diana.
Maybe Diana just looks like the person you see everyday, everywhere.
Can confirm, but I didn't realize until I was actually playing Classic Diana with a friend on Warden Sivir. It's _really_ similar.
Diana main; I think the new skin  leaves something to be desired. It's too uniform. Sounds are decent though.
Yeah, its too similar. I would not have made Diana's armor black. I would have went with White or Silver.
I was really hype for this skin but it was a miss for me. I might not buy it at all. Maybe in a few months when it goes on sale for 975 RP but definitely not at 1350 RP. The head is a mess, lol.
Volcanic Wukong and Wildfire Zyra walk into the moon...
All could have been avoided if we had just voted for {{champion:111}}
